ngiemboon: N dáʼ ńgíŋ ńgwaa piŋe Yelúzálèm, mbà é cʉ̌a ngùʼ ntsɔ̀b lekùɔ né legém, ńgwaa piŋ púʼu, peg Panébásè gwɔ́, ńgíŋ ńdɔg mbɔɔ Titúsè ńgʉa.
en: Then after fourteen years I went up again   to Jerusalem with Barnabas,  # 2:1 Ac 4:36 taking Titus  # 2:1 Ti 1:4 along also.

ngiemboon: N dɔ̌ɔn ńgee wó, mélàʼmie Ssé la gɔɔn ngie n gʉa wó. N da tóo wó, ńkyagte nkʉ̀ mbòŋo gẅie n tsẅii mbwó pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yúndà wɔ́, éshwóŋ pʉ̀a pie mé lɔ́ɔn ńdíe wɔ́b ngie ée melÿò. Peg lâ pɔ̌ néŋe pɔ́ jʉʼʉ ntsem tá n kyagte éshwóŋo wɔ́b. Púʼu, nue n da te ne ńkwoŋo ngie afàʼ gie n dǎ faʼ mbɔɔ gie n ne faʼa, à cʉa sẅɛ̀ɛ wɔ́.
en: I went up according to a revelation   and presented to them the gospel I preach among the Gentiles, but privately to those recognized as leaders. I wanted to be sure I was not running, and had not been running, in vain.

ngiemboon: Titúsè gẅie peg yé la gwɔ́, à laa nyìŋ Ngelékiya, táʼ, tà mbɔɔ púʼu, pɔ́ ké te sẅɛ́ɛ yé ngie à zẅíŋ mé púʼu yé tá à gwɔ́ nyìŋ Ssé wɔ́.
en: But not even Titus, who was with me, was compelled to be circumcised, even though he was a Greek.

ngiemboon: Tà mbɔɔ páʼ tsɔ́ pacÿɔnò ngie pɔ́ ée mefɛ̌ pég, é la ne ńkwoŋo ngie mé púʼu yé. Epʉ̀a ŋwɛ́ la shú ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ nùɔ yég páʼ ngàŋa náŋ. Pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ńtóo légyá páʼ peg ee pà ndùnnɛ́ na mà pà Yúndà, ńcʉa na Yěsô Keleto ńgÿo még menò púʼu. Pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn faʼa lélɔgɔ wég ńgÿo menkwɔɔn.
en: This matter arose because some false brothers   had infiltrated our ranks to spy on the freedom we have in Christ Jesus in order to enslave us.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, peg la te zẅíŋe tsɔ́ nò mbwó pʉ̀a ŋwɛ́ wɔ́, tà mbɔɔ lénáʼá ńzẅíŋ tá ḿbiŋ ńdʉʼ. Púʼu, légwɔ́ gie nkʉ̀ mbòŋo ge tyé pɔ́ ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ é gwɔ́, pi zẅɛ́ʼ.
en: But we did not give up and submit to these people for even a moment, so that the truth   of the gospel would be preserved for you.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa na pʉ̀a pie mé lɔ́ɔn ńdíe wɔ́b ngie pɔ́ ee melÿò, mbà pɔ́ la te gyá ngie pɔ́ ge kẅiʼi tsɔ́ mmó na nò gie n tsẅii wɔ́. Ammó gie pɔ́ la zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ yɛ̌ fʉ̀ʼʉmvfò, á té líe wɔ́ɔn na tsɔ́ nò wɔ́. Á nue e Ssé te gẅiin tyɛ̀ʼte na pʉ̀a mesoŋ wɔ́.
en: Now from those recognized as important (what they   once were makes no difference to me; God does not show favoritism  # 2:6 Or God is not a respecter of persons; lit God does not receive the face of man,# 2:6 Dt 16:19) #— #they added nothing to me.

ngiemboon: Tà ńcʉ́ʼ púʼu, mbà pɔ́ la gyá pɔ́ ngie e Ssé la cʉ́me létsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo né pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yúndà wɔ́, á mbwó mèŋ ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ à la cʉ́me mbwó Piɛ létsẅii mbwó pʉ̀a pie ée pà Yúndà.
en: On the contrary, they saw that I had been entrusted with the gospel for the uncircumcised,   just as Peter  # 2:7 Lk 6:14; Ac 10:32 was for the circumcised,

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngie e Ssé gẅie à la zɔɔn ńnáa Piɛ tʉ̀, ńtúmo yé mbwó pà Yúndà, yé zɔ la gíŋ ńnáa wɔ́ɔn tʉ̀, ńtúmo wɔ́ɔn mbwó pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yúndà wɔ́.
en: since the one at work in Peter for an apostleship to the circumcised was also at work in me for the Gentiles.

ngiemboon: Jÿâg, Piɛ mbɔɔ Jÿâŋ, é pʉ̀a pie mé lɔ́ɔn ńdíe wɔ́b páʼ mentóon tsɛ̀ɛ cúʼtè pʉ̀a Keleto la, pɔ́ la gwɔ́ tà ńzsé ngie e Ssé la kwàʼ ńcʉ́me yɔɔn fàʼ mbwó mèŋ, ńnáa pwó né peg Panébásè, lélɔg ńdaʼte ngie peg lâ pɔ̌ ee tàʼ ncwò na fàʼa Ssé. Púʼu, peg gẅiin légʉa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yúndà wɔ́, ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo, pɔ́ yɔ́b pâ Piɛ gẅiin légʉa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pà Yúndà ńtsẅi.
en: When James,   Cephas,  # 2:9 Other mss read Peter,# 2:9 Jn 1:42 and John  # 2:9 Jn 21:7  #— #those recognized as pillars  # 2:9 1Tm 3:15; Rv 3:12; 10:1  #— #acknowledged the grace that had been given to me, they gave the right hand of fellowship to me and Barnabas, agreeing that we should go to the Gentiles and they to the circumcised.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gɔɔn né peg pɔ́ ndàʼ ngie peg kímte mepóŋ pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ cúʼtè pʉ̀a Keleto á Yelúzálèm. N ka kě ńkímte wɔ́b kwàʼ mboŋó.
en: They asked only that we would remember the poor,   which I had made every effort to do.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, Piɛ la gÿo ńtóo Aŋtiyokia mèŋ shʉashʉa ńtyé mvfò láʼ ńdʉʼʉ mmó gie à gÿǒ, á nue à la gwaa gwɔ́, mbà à fʉ̌a nò.
en: But when Cephas   came to Antioch, I opposed him to his face because he stood condemned.  # 2:11 Or he was in the wrong

ngiemboon: Ayɛ̌ nò gwɔ́ páʼ, epʉ̀a pie Jÿâg la túm, é la gwaa tó, Piɛ pâ pʉ̀a Keleto pie é té pà Yúndà wɔ́ ne ńteme ńjÿó mmó. Pɛ̌ pʉ̀a gwɔ́ tà ńtó, á lɔg pɔ́ ndɔɔn ndɔɔn ńkẅɛɛ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, pâ pɔ̌ cʉ́ʼʉ ńteme mmó wɔ́, á nue à la ne ḿbɔ́gɔ nò gie pʉ̀a pie é kẅite nò lépúʼ pʉ̀a ge gɔɔn na yé.
en: For he regularly ate with the Gentiles before certain men came from James. However, when they came, he withdrew and separated himself, because he feared those from the circumcision party.

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ mefɛ̌ mefɛ̌ pie é laa Aŋtiyokia ńgwɔ́ pà Yúndà, é gíŋ ńkẅɛ yɔ́b pà zẅíŋe ncwò ńdʉʼʉ lóŋ páʼ Piɛ. Á gwɔ́ gwɔ̌ tà kwàʼ Panébásè gíŋ ńgÿo yé pɔ́ púʼu.
en: Then the rest of the Jews   joined his hypocrisy,  # 2:13 Mk 12:15 so that even Barnabas was led astray by their hypocrisy.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, n da gwɔ́ tà ńgyá ngie pɔ́ té ne ńgiŋe ndʉŋndʉŋ na páʼ nkʉ̀ mbòŋo ée jʉʼó ńgwɔ́ púʼu wɔ́, é shʉashʉa ńtyé mvfò láʼ, ńgɔɔn mbwó Piɛ ngie: «Gù gẅie ɔɔ nyìŋ Yúndà, ɔ̀ kɔ̌ɔn ńnéŋe jʉʼɔɔn na ntí gie pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yúndà wɔ́ ne ńnéŋe, tà ɔ̀ těen ńnéŋe páʼ nyìŋ Yúndà wɔ́. Ɔ̀ piŋe faʼa lésẅɛ́ pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yúndà wɔ́, lénéŋe páʼ pà Yúndà mélàʼakɔ́?»
en: But when I saw that they were deviating from the truth of the gospel, I told Cephas   in front of everyone, “If you, who are a Jew, live like a Gentile  # 2:14 Rm 1:13 and not like a Jew,  # 2:14 Rm 14:2 how can you compel Gentiles to live  # 2:14 Rm 6:2 like Jews? ”  # 2:14 Some translations continue the quotation through v. 16 or v. 21.

ngiemboon: N gɔɔn né Piɛ páʼɔɔn, á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngie peg lâ pɔ̌, é pà Yúndà tà fó lyɛʼɛ́ nzyé, peg te pʉ̀a pie é kaa ndòon páʼ petsɔ́ meláʼ, é mie é té zsé lepʉ̌ Ssé wɔ́ wɔ́.
en: We are Jews by birth and not “Gentile sinners,”

ngiemboon: Táʼ, peg ké ne ńzsé ngie nyìŋ mesoŋ te gwaa gwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie e Ssé cʉ̌ʼ ńdíe yé pɔ́ páʼ nyìŋ gẅie aa ndʉŋndʉŋ mvfò yé, á fóo na páʼ ngàŋ gɔɔn ngie à kúʼte lepʉ̌ Ssé wɔ́. Á zɛ́te pɔ́ ngie à záb ntʉ́m wé na Yěsô Keleto. Áa mmó gie á la gÿo, peg yég záb ntʉ́m wég na Yěsô Keleto, páʼ peg ge gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é Ssé cʉʼʉ́ ńdíe wɔ́b pɔ́ páʼ pʉ̀a pie ée ndʉŋndʉŋ mvfò yé. À ké fó pɔ́ na páʼ peg zǎb ntʉ́m na Keleto, tà á le gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie peg kúʼte lepʉ̌ wɔ́. Á nue e Ssé la zɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie sɔɔn nyìŋ té láʼ gwaa kuʼu légwɔ́ ndʉŋndʉŋ mvfò yé à fó na páʼ ngàŋ gɔɔn ngie à kúʼte lepʉ̌ wɔ́.
en: and yet because we know that a person is not justified by the works of the law   but by faith in Jesus Christ,  # 2:16 Or by the faithfulness of Jesus Christ even we ourselves have believed in Christ Jesus. This was so that we might be justified by faith in Christ  # 2:16 Or by the faithfulness of Christ and not by the works of the law, because by the works of the law no human being will  # 2:16 Lit law all flesh will not be justified.

ngiemboon: Páʼ peg ne faʼa lécʉa ndàʼ nzèm Keleto tá ńkuʼ pʉ̀a pie ée mvfò Ssé ńgwɔ́ ndʉŋndʉŋ la, pà Yúndà lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ péʼe ńdɔgɔ wég ńtóŋ pʉ̀a pie ndòon ee twó pɔ́b, páʼ pɔ́ tóŋo pʉ̀a pie é té zsé lepʉ̌ Ssé wɔ́, á lɔgɔ púʼu, ńgwɔ́ ngie Keleto aa nyìŋ gẅie à gÿo pʉ̀a kaa pɔ́ ndòon keen? Ngǎŋ, á té púʼu wɔ́.
en: But if we ourselves are also found to be “sinners” while seeking to be justified by Christ,   is Christ then a promoter  # 2:17 Or servant,# 2:17 1Co 3:5 of sin? Absolutely not!  # 2:17 Lk 20:16

ngiemboon: Ngwɔ́ n gíŋ ńzɔɔn ńzáb ntʉ́m wɔ́ɔn na nò lepʉ̌ gie n ka nyé lá? N gÿo púʼu, mbà kwàʼ mèŋ, n ge lɔg nyɛ ngie n gee nyìŋ gẅie à fʉ̌a lepʉ̌, é lɔgɔ púʼu, é kaa ndòon.
en: If I rebuild   those things that I tore down, I show myself to be a lawbreaker.  # 2:18 Rm 2:25,27; Jms 2:9,11

ngiemboon: Á kaa fʉ̀ʼ gie n ka nyě ńne faʼa ngie e Ssé fó na páʼ n gɔɔn ngie n kúʼte lepʉ̌, ńcʉ́ʼ ńdíe wɔ́ɔn pɔ́ páʼ nyìŋ gẅie aa ndʉŋndʉŋ, n júʼ ngie ngwɔ́ á le gwɔ́ púʼu wɔ́. Áa yɛ̌ tá n cʉ́ʼ ńgwɔ́ na nò lepʉ̌ yɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mpfó, púʼu, ńzsé ngie n ge gwɔ́ mvfò Ssé é gwɔ́ ntʉ̀ntʉ̀. E Ssé la zɔɔn ńteme wég Keleto mé púte wég yé ńkime na tÿǒnkǐ.
en: For through the law I died to the law,   so that I might live for God.  # 2:19 Php 1:21

ngiemboon: Mèŋ zɔ te páʼɔɔn ńgíŋe ésáʼa twó mbùm yɔ́ɔn mɔ́, Keleto zɔ cʉ̌ʼ ńgwɔ́ soŋ nnɛ́ mèŋ ésáʼa wɔ́ɔn. N dɔɔn ńgÿo pɔ́ kɔ́ wɔ́ɔ, mbà á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie m bǔ ńzáb ntʉ́m wɔ́ɔn na Míŋ Ssé. Aa nyìŋ gẅie à la kwoŋo wɔ́ɔn kwoŋ tà ńkwé na twó yɔ́ɔn.
en: I have been crucified with Christ, and I no longer live, but Christ lives in me.   The life I now live in the body,  # 2:20 Lit flesh I live by faith in the Son of God,  # 2:20 Jn 5:19; Heb 1:2 who loved  # 2:20 Jn 3:16 me  # 2:20 2Th 2:13 and gave himself  # 2:20 Ti 2:14 for me.  # 2:20 Lk 20:38; Rm 14:8

ngiemboon: N těen ńge zẅíŋ, anò mbòŋo gie Ssé la lɔg ńcÿó gʉm yɔ́ɔn, à cʉa sẅɛ̀ɛ wɔ́. N gɔɔn mélàʼmie à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ gie ngwɔ́ nyìŋ cʉa na nò lepʉ̌ tá Ssé líe yé páʼ nyìŋ gẅie aa ndʉŋndʉŋ, mbà á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngie Keleto la kwé pɔ́ sẅɛ̀ɛ sẅɛ̀ɛ.
en: I do not set aside the grace of God, for if righteousness comes through the law,   then Christ died  # 2:21 1Co 8:11; Php 3:10 for nothing.
